Pycom LoPy4 Modules:¶

  • Sensors’ Modules and Methods:
    • battery sensor:
    • gas sensor:
    • gps sensor:
    • humidity sensor:
    • pm sensor (dust):

boot.py¶

In this module is the configuration of the LoPy4 when it boots, the interfaces and hardware features availables at the booting

main.py¶

Main module:

Contains the main execution, the constants to create a message to be sent and the creation of the sensors.

main.isTimeToTakeMeasure(sensorLastMeasure, sensorMeasureInterval)¶

Verifies if the measure interval of a given sensor is completed and returns True or False Arguments:

SensorLastMeasure:
 Time of the last measure taken in miliseconds
SensorMeasureInterval:
 Interval of time predefined between each measure in miliseconds
main.main()¶

Contains the Main while loop, where in each iteration based on measurement predefined intervals takes a measure and stores it. When the send time interval is achieved, all the measures taken at that moment are saved in a message and are sent to the server. You can modify the diferent intervals here

loraconnection.py¶

This Module handles the configuration of the socket to create the LoRa connection to the server. You have to modify the app_eui & the app_key for the OTAA authentication with your Lora Gateway

loraconnection.get_time()¶

Sending of the Messages to the LoRa SERVER for getting the datetime

loraconnection.joinLNS()¶

Creation of the LoRa Connection

loraconnection.sendMessage(msg_cbor)¶

Sending of the Messages to the LoRa SERVER

Msg_cbor:Message Encoded in Cbor with the measures taken.
